title: SPE Chapter 03 - Plugins: Same Interface, Different Architecture
description:
Chapter 03 of Simple PHP Examples - introducing the plugin architecture that restructures everything while changing nothing visible.

This chapter presents a paradox: the browser shows exactly the same interface as Chapter Two, yet the PHP code has been completely reorganized. Four named classes replace the single anonymous class, establishing the foundation for extensible applications.

Key concepts covered:
‚Ä¢ Ctx readonly class for configuration context
‚Ä¢ Init class for request processing and dispatch
‚Ä¢ Dynamic plugin dispatch with match(true) pattern
‚Ä¢ Abstract Plugin base with CRUDL method stubs
‚Ä¢ PHP 8.3 #[Override] attribute on plugin methods
‚Ä¢ Automatic JSON API via ?x=json parameter
‚Ä¢ Convention over configuration architecture
